page.title: 05INDUSTRY 1.
page.content: Viewed from the highest vantage point there is little to be seen of any ind_ ustry within this block. (see slide 1) Apart from a small privately owned drift at Newfield the traditional coal mining has gone. On the eastern bound_ ary can be seen a coal storage/washing depot,& at Binchester Blocks a chapel has been converted to the manufacture of leather gloves (previously a pyjama factory). Such chapels, deconsecrated, seem to be the focus for small firms coming into the area, e.g. a similar empty chapel at Newfield may become a mushroom farm. It is at Newfield/Todhills we still see larger industries; quarrying the river banks for the raw materials re_ quired by the large brickworks at Tod_ hills. Hereabouts, the river flats are used for tipping waste and there is a sewage disposal plant.
